author: Raghu48
body: Fun fact: Hamilton never finished above fifth in WDC between '08 and '13 despite driving a competitive car. So, it's not like he can't be challenged with  competitive cars on the grd. That unfortunately didn't happen in Hybrid era. There is always been a one horse or 2 horse race.

author: 95Daphne
body:
It has a gap at $58 that could fill if it doesn't bounce relatively soon.

However, there are likely better opportunities now in semis, or something like WDC, that could be taken advantage of off that MU downgrade. AMAT and LRCX are two of the names...guess who has both in one account and is not enjoying this week...(but won't be paper handing, just don't feel as if being heroic is a good idea here because of the below)

Problem is, your guess is as good as my guess on if this is going to turn into a bigger dip for the semiconductor sector or not. It's the 3rd time in the past month or so where it looks as if it may go. First 2 times turned into a no, this time...????

author: Mysterious----
body:
Well it’s possible for one tomorrow and Friday and the gamma to force the naked calls to cover and buy, but that takes a lot of volume. If somehow this closes above $9 on Friday this thing would sky rocket. But we are talking 10s of millions in volume. You would need to get all of retail in on it to buy tonight until Friday. The float on this thing is so small that a coordinated squeeze would take this literally to the moon. Short positions are also disclosed and there are a lot of institutions that opened shorts last week. Forgot exactly what prices. There were also buyers that bought puts to cover risk. I am no fortune teller so I can’t tell if or when it’ll happen. But an article did come out saying investment firms are expanding positions in this. 

https://www.gurufocus.com/news/1504573/ardsley-advisory-partners-lp-buys-sunrun-inc-western-digital-corp-alibaba-group-holding-sells-baidu-inc-the-aes-corp-vertex-pharmaceuticals-inc/?r=21637c73084e87d770a98f867757282f

This portfolio is an example. They are selling off tech and getting into renewables and infrastructure. This will be the trend but it will take off more in The coming weeks. Right now you have options that need to expire before MMs let it run. But catalysts and squeezes can beat MMs. Hell if WSB jumps on this and starts buying and holding this will run past $20 EOW. After options expire in the money sky is the limit. 

Very unlikely like I said I am looking at the long term growth and see a lot of value in this. Best bet is buying leaps or calls very far out. The price point right now is at a critical level and the support is strong but it needs to stay above $6.82 tomorrow. If not she will slide further. If she holds then we reverse and go up, which is what I believe will happen.

author: cuchiplancheo
body:
> The fuck is ZEBRA

No fucking clue. But, found more info: [ZEBRA stands for Zero Extrinsic Back Ratio, a term coined by Liz and Jenny in their TastyTrade show.](https://optionstradingiq.com/the-comprehensive-guide-to-the-zebra-strategy/)

author: ZeekLTK
body:
Writing the same thing for every question is probably the best way to do it though (assuming it's a word/phrase that you will easily remember but no one else would think of).

Just doing something like "banana" or "zebra" or whatever, then if anyone finds out any of your actual info they still won't be able to answer the security questions. "What's your first pet's name?" "Pizza" "Mother's maiden name?" "Pizza", "Song from wedding?" "Pizza". lol no one would ever "guess" that.

author: PapaCharlie9
body: LOL. ZEBRA and PMCC are not *better* for new traders who wouldn't know a back ratio from a back stroke. Inherently, any multi-leg options trade is going to be more complicated than a single leg trade. Simplicity is good for beginners.
